Reviews.Title: A much needed improvement of the coolpix range
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: I found the last generation of coolpix cameras to be disappointing at best. This one however has received some massive improvements.1. It's very very fastIt is speedy in all ways possible. The shutter response time in almost instantaneous. As soon as you click the button the photo takes... give 1 additional second in poor lighting at worst. Best of all is the photo navigation. Remember those old coolpix commercials where Ashton Kutcher would flick his finger and all the photos would scroll by fast? That never worked before, but it actually does on this one. There is no lag whatsoever on photo viewing or changing settings.2. Excellent photo qualityI was playing with this in best buy and it took very noticeably clearer photos than the other camera in the same price range... including the Canon powershots. Its actually what made me decide to buy one before I learned all the other good stuff.3. FunctionalityIt doesn't allow manual exposure and aperture controls because of its size. However they give you a ton of different scene modes to play around with. Some are a little too niche to matter, but all the main ones are there. Also you can do lots of adjustments to a photo that has already been taken. These are made even easier by using the little included stylus which hangs off your camera strap. The camera has a very good feature which allows you to choose the focus of your picture simply by tapping it on the screen. Finally a purpose to using a touch screen besides flashiness.4. LooksIts slim and the screen is large and clear. It's very minimalistic with only 2 buttons on the back. The camera looks very traditional and minimalistic, like most of the coolpix range. It doesn't look or feel cheap by all means, but you're not gonna turn heads when you use it... unless of course you're caught scrolling your library (which does feel pretty cool).The Bad PartsThis camera only has a couple of negative issues. First off, the lens does not retract into the body when you're viewing photos. It means you can switch to shooting really fast, but it also burdens the way in which you can hold your camera. I would have liked to have been able to hold it flat in my palm while looking at my photos. Another problem is that it doesn't use a battery charger, it charges with a usb cable that plugs directly into the camera. It comes with an AC power adapter that you can plug the cable into if you want... kind of like what an ipod uses. I guess it makes everything simpler and you can carry less stuff when you travel, but I like to charge extra batteries while I'm using my camera.The touchscreen has a slightly matte surface. Which means it gets very dirty very fast. I put a surface shield on this immediately and it has eliminated that problem completely... but it also makes the touch controls slightly less responsive. If you do this, you can still control the camera well with your finger, but it's faster and easier to navigate photos with the stylus.I HIGHLY recommend this camera to anyone needing a good point and shoot, especially if speed is important to you.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, stylish, easy to use and excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: Surgery100 "ADJ"
Reviews.Content: Summary: A great everyday camera. Very good quality pictures, simple to use and very stylish. Small enough that can easily fit in a shirt or pant pocket. Gives you more options in terms of color and exposure manipulations than similarly priced cameras. You can even do basic photo editing using the included stylus. It also has the cool factor of having a touch screen for all controls.Hi-def video:720p, 24 frames per second. Does not include an HDMI port, so movies have to be downloaded into a computer to be seen.Picture sharing:You get 2GB free online storage to share pictures on the web.Hardware:Touch screen: this is the camera's main control mechanism, and it delivers. Bright screen that can easily be seen in bright light. Large virtual buttons that make navigating the options quite easy. Ok responsiveness, not the fastest, but certainly adequate.Flash: It is tiny. Adequate only for filling in shadows, but in a dimly lit, indoor setting you get some noise on the pictures (as the camera automatically adjusts the ISO). Indoor images tended to be well focused despite the small flash.Battery: I took 425 pictures (no flash) without needing to recharge.Ease of use: Once you get used to the idea that there are no buttons readily available (all buttons and commands go through the touch screen on the back) it is quite easy to use. There are some settings (such as BBS) which require a quick review of the manual to know what they are for.Burst mode: Contrary to other cameras in this group (i.e. Canon A3100) this one includes a burst mode which allows to take up to 16 images in rapid succession.Pre-set scene mode: Gives you the common ones (portrait, landscape, children running, etc.) and some new ones, such as fireworks and dawn. There are 16 different scenes to choose from there are as many options as higher end models.

Reviews.Title: First Nikon Coolpix I've had
Reviews.Author: Karen L. Cesar "A Fan"
Reviews.Content: I have a few cameras:  Olympus DLSR, Canon Powershot S3IS, and Panasonic Lumix (compact).  I've also owned Kodak digital easyshares and Pentax film camers.I've been power shopping the last few days for a good point and shoot for an upcoming trip I'm taking to CA.  I'll be taking my Olympus DSLR, put need a pocket camera for those times a DLSR isn't appropriate due to size.Having owned a Canon Powershot S3IS and an Olympus DLSR, I'm pretty picky about image quality.  So I brought home a Canon 1300 and a Nikon s4000 and compared photos in Photoshop.  Hands down, Nikon s4000 won everytime.  Indoor, outdoor, flash, speed, ease of use, etc.This is an easty, point and shoot with great color and picture quality.I'd recommend it.The reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the way you have to charge the battery.  The battery has to be charged while in the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera!
Reviews.Author: P. Sherman
Reviews.Content: It's interesting how Amazon has divided up the reviews for the Coolpix S4000 based on the color of the camera (at least as of this writing). Moving on: This is a nice little camera, it's the third in my collection of compacts, the only one with a touch screen. I have posted photos taken with it, both post-processed and straight out of the camera. My notes:There is an issue with charging the battery. This has been mentioned in at least one other review, don't remember the color of that camera (doesn't matter). Recharging is not done as described in the quick start guide. Put the USB connector in the wall plug-in part, and plug it into your outlet, THEN attach the other end to the camera. This is the only way that the camera will be triggered to turn on and recharge. Wall first, camera second.The guide says charging a fully discharged battery can take up to two hours and 10 minutes, or thereabouts. After three and a half hours, though the light was still blinking, I unplugged mine during its first charge. The battery icon did not show up in the display, meaning it was charged.The default should not be for digital zoom to be turned on. Make your first menu adjustment turning that off!Another reviewer got the best results with a setting of 3m for the images. I set mine at 8 and they seem fine; unless you are going to print very large posters, you also may want to cut back from the 12m.Flash settings aren't sticky, so if you turned it off and then turned the camera off, the flash will be back on auto when you turn it back on.I found the color to be good, white balance to be fairly accurate, exposure to be so-so, all in auto scene mode. The touch screen works well but it does pick up fingerprints--scrolling and selecting worked better for me using my fingernail; they provide a stylus that can be attached to the strap and would also help reduce greasiness on the screen.The red version looks just plain cool. It's very small, even for a compact, and very lightweight. It's a camera for snapshots, and with that limitation in mind, I think it does very well. (Don't over-expect.) I noticed that it sometimes found more than one focus spot in a scene, and that worked well. Mine came with a carrying case included in the box. It comes with the full manual on a CD. The card readers built into both my laptop and desktop computers (both Windows 7, a Dell and an HP) were able to read the card with no problem, so I did not install any of the software that came with it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S4000 12MP
Reviews.Author: Ronald R. Riesbeck "Ron"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera on a Nikon promotion for Mothers Day.  It included a case and a Sand Dish 2g card.  I would like to tell you of some issues I had with this camera and have since cleared it up with a call to Nikon.Charging the battery:First, is how to charge the battery.  You must plug the a/c charger into a electrical outlet.....THEN.....plug the adapter into the charge port of the camera.  If you try it any other way, it won't charge.  The quick start, manual on CD and the downloadable manual from Nikon............spell it out the wrong way.Firmware update:My camera came with version 1.0.  If you go to [...]  you will find a new version is waiting for you to download.  They also have an illustrated file to download to help you do the update.  The SD card is formatted by the camera........... .......a PC will not read the card.  My XP pro did not read the card.  Therefore, you cannot copy the firmware to the SD disk.  My Windows 7 machine did read it, copied it and I made an update to my camera.  So your XP machine might not be able to do the update.Another issue is how to power the camera during the update.  The instructions were not clear to me and a call to Nikon approves of this approach.  Use a fully charged battery as the only power source and you will be able to complete the update.The update will change the HD video from 24 to 30fps.If you buy a SD card...check with the 200 page manual to see what cards are approved.  Write times vary with manufacture.  The Sand Disk, I felt, had a rapid write time.I am pleased with the camera.  It is packed with features that Amazon points out during camera description.  It should be noted that in AUTO, the camera picks out what it likes to make your shot.  AUTO is a place to START making your perfect photo.  The camera has many features to fine tune that shot into a family treasure.  Spend some time and try ALL the features and see what happens to the same photo shot.  Its part of the fun of digital cameras.  I don't mind saying, I resisted digital and stayed with film for many years.  This camera will allow you to be creative in a much faster pace.  Is it going to replace a 650$ SLR.  No way.  It will allow you to carry a very cool pocket camera to get those "grab me shots" or just really get into digital photography.Nikon can be reached at 1 800 645 6689  7days a week from 8am to 2am Eastern time.  They were very patient and helpful to me during my two calls to them.  Also try their web site for answers on consumer questions on this camera.  There was an answer on XP problems during transfer from camera to pc.  I need to look that one over next

Reviews.Title: Kind of disappointing
Reviews.Author: E. Blake "amazonlover"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera with a rechargeable battery that takes good quality high-resolution pics along with HD video with zoom available during video taking. This camera's touchscreen interface was great. I really enjoyed the options available along with having the ability to press a button for preview and some settings (not 100% touchscreen), but was disappointed with the quality of the photos and video. The video was nowhere near HD. I played with the settings and used it outside with plenty of light and it was choppy and noisy. I installed the included photo software and that just made it play without breaking up every second, but it was still not HD. I took some photos in low light indoors and played with the ISO settings along with the auto setting and none of them proved to be adequate. You get fuzzy photos without the flash too. In good lighting I found the photos to be too soft around the edges of faces and routinely took blurry pics too. I had to try a couple times just to get a solid photo of my toddler...not enough of a stabilizing feature for me.I returned it with regret and am looking into Canon compact digital cameras because the Canon Powershot SX20IS that we have now we are very happy with.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: T. Schafer
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  It takes awesome pictures and great videos.  The touch-panel is a great bonus as well.  At this price and with this quality, you can't beat it.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Got a lot for the price
Reviews.Author: FD Firefighter 121 "Remember the 343"
Reviews.Content: This was for my wife. She just needs a point and shoot for her vacation in Europe, family gatherings etc. and this fits the bill.This camera packs a lot of features and I am very surprised how robust the features are. This will even take videos!Do make sure you you get the best SD card you can. I got SanDisk SDHC Class 10 High Performance memory card. You need to get Class 6 or higher if you want to use Video Mode.I got the little case to hold the camera in her bag safely. I also got an extra battery for this the Nikon EN-EL10 Rechargeable Battery.You need to hold the camera while the picture is written to the card to avoid blur. I hope a higher end SD card will write a little faster. If you shoot and hold you won't have any issues.All in all it takes great pictures, easy to operate, more features than I expected and an easy interface to figure it all out. This is a nice camera to have conveniently packed in a pocket or purse for those times you are not carrying around your DSLR or Video camera. All at a competitive price.

Reviews.Title: Loved it!
Reviews.Author: msbrownie
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to buy a nikon digital camera because i just loved my canon but when i received my nikon digital camera i loved how  it's very easy to use, loved the itouch screen and the video are great as well, the only thing that bother's me is when i  take pictures at night the flash is too bright and so my kids doesn't like it when i take their pictures at night, other than that i just loved them. i did my research and amazon has the cheapest price and they shipped pretty fast.

Reviews.Title: Better Than I Expected!
Reviews.Author: K.O. Baecker
Reviews.Content: When I was first scouring the net for reviews on this baby, I kept coming across "image resolution not as good as advertised" and "deleting photos is such a pain" but personally, I found the resolution of this camera absolutely amazing. While I do agree that it does take a while to delete individual photos, it's actually not so bad when you're deleting photos en masse. (A lot of people complained of the absence of that particular feature, but in reality you just zoom out while flipping through photos, hit the little garbage bin, just tap each photo you want to delete, and hit OK.) The flash is surprisingly pretty good, though you have to hold down the shutter button for like, two whole seconds, and it's crazy bright, but it's tolerable. And I love the flash-only-to-reduce-red-eye option! The start up and shut down is nice and quick, too. I like how slim and small it is, makes it easier to just shove in my skinny jeans pocket or into a small handbag. The touch-screen is also pretty magnificent, and it's actually really sensitive to touch; there's an option to take a photo just by tapping the screen, and all I did was graze my fingertip on the screen and it took the photo! (The camera comes with a stylus, in case you're like me: paranoid about getting icky finger prints and such on your screen.) Editing isn't great, but the quality makes up for it. And what made this even better was the very reliable shipping. Overall, I definitely recommend this camera. But if slight lag, super-bright flashes and touch screens aren't your thing, I suggest looking for something else.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing time until next picture
Reviews.Author: Stacy I. "stacystamper"
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this camera except the Image Review time setting.  The only option for Image Review is On or Off.  I primarily take pictures of my young children, so I need the instant image review after taking a picture so that I can make sure I got the shot.  However the image review time is between 5-7 seconds and there's no option to reduce that time.  My previous Kodak would clear the image review when I pressed the shutter button, but this one doesn't have that feature or any other way to clear the image review early. Turning off the image review just doesn't work for me since I then would have to hope I got the picture or go into the image review and check the shot.  It's also possible that it just takes too long to store the image, though this doesn't seem to be the case when I turn off image review.  Nikon tech support wasn't very helpful.  They said that maybe a faster data card would help (I have a class 2 I believe though they weren't even able to help me confirm the class.)The size of the camera is great and picture quality seems good and the price is good.  The touch screen is also great and it's easy to use.Unfortunately the image review issue is a deal breaker so I'm looking into a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Diane B. Holstrom
Reviews.Content: I have another bigger camera with more creative options which I love for vacations and scenery, but I really wanted a camera that I could always carry in my purse or pocket to capture life's fun moments.  I find it easier to take pictures of people when they aren't intimidated by a bigger camera.  This is fun and easy to use and the touch screen is great. It has a lot of amazing features, too. My only complaint is that I would like a hard copy of the instruction manual instead of on a CD.  I like to browse through it at my leisure.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures from Nikon
Reviews.Author: Val En Tine
Reviews.Content: I was unsure if I wanted to purchase a touch screen camera. Reservations are gone! Love the automatic point-and-shoot feature. It picks the right setting whether indoors or out to create beautiful pics. I purchased this one because I can use my memory card and batteries from my old camera and the carrying case (I should have left my old camera in the case instead of tossing into center arm rest and crushing it). The Nikon fits nicely in my pocket to take unposed interesting pictures of family and places of interest. The touch screen makes it very simple to view pictures after they are taken. Thank You Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use, Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: smexiibeast11
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this camera, and it had gotten mixed reviews so I was a little nervous about buying it. But after I opened the box and started using it I was overjoyed! This camera takes amazing pictures, with great quality! It is the best camera I have ever bought! The nature pictures turn out extremely well and I love all the features. The only thing I dislike about it would be that sometimes you can't see the touch screen very well in the sunlight and sometimes it takes a while to focus! But other than that it is a great camera for a great price, I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S4000
Reviews.Author: Gaston Labougle "Lanas"
Reviews.Content: The camera is quite good. I bought it because it gave me the oportunity to tape videos with quite a good resolution, and also to be able to take easy pictures on venues or occasions where I can't take my DSLR.Pictures are very nice, although I haven't seen them printed yet. Video quality is also very good.The down side is that the camera is a bit slow on recording (with a class 4 SD card). As for the picture quality, I notice it doesn't expose that well on overcast weather, and also that the colours seem a bit undersaturated in general. Nothing that Photoshop can't solve, but maybe for this type of casual photography I wouldn't feel like having to post-process my pictures.Other than these issues this is a very fine product.Happy shooting!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Schafe "Schafe"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera for a trip to Israel and only had one complaint: the life of the battery is too short.By the end of the day taking pictures and recording short videos, the battery, (which I charged nightly), pooped out.  The camera was very easy to use, which was a real plus, and the photo's captured were brilliant and clear.  The pictures taken while in motion, i.e.  while our tour bus was moving didn't fair so well.  Those photo's were all a bit hazy with the glare of sunlight and the reflection of the glass.  But all in all, I'd make the same purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Judy Smith "judylynnsbooks"
Reviews.Content: My canon camera finally conked out after 10 years and my husband bought me this one to replace it. I love it. It practically does everything itself. Fits in the palm of your hand so you can walk down road snapping pictures without anyone even knowing what you are doing. I put a couple on here to show you how vivid they are. I am an amateur when it comes to photography but I thought these came out great...so I give full credit to the camera. I certainly never took that good a pictures with the other one. It also has different settings to make it easier...like for snow, sunset, darkness, portrait, landscape, sports, etc. And the little video does great too. Unbelievable that one little camera can do all this and cost a third of what my canon cost 10 years ago. Very easy to install the software but doesn't have a lot of directions in the booklet that comes with it. There is a disc but it doesn't have a lot of information either. Actually you don't need to know much though. Once you start playing with it, you learn it pretty quick. It will literally store hundreds of pictures before you have to delete them out for more space. What a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Useche
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera! We're very happy with it, very light and comfortable, modern design, huge (and fun) touchscreen. Absolutely satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Overall, a great point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: J. Hollyday
Reviews.Content: I've had Nikon point-and-shoots in the past, and this is an improvement with the higher resolution, the nifty features and the touch screen. I like how the touchscreen makes navigating the menus a quick affair instead of the endless menu surfing of the past, and the resolution is a high enough quality for me to be happy with while I bide my time for a nice SLR. The slim body makes it easy to slip the camera into pockets and purses, and the camera is relatively lightweight. It has enough features and options to choose from that I can get the photos I want in less-than-ideal environments (low lighting, taking pictures around glass/mirrors, backlighting, etc.).the reason for the 4 stars: The Smart Portrait feature is kind of annoying. It works great half the time but only under very specific conditions: good environment lighting, clear subject(s), and you better be quick and not accidentally close your eyes! Also, my husband has facial hair, and the camera doesn't know where to focus, and therefore hardly takes a picture of him. I have simply turned the feature off.If anything changes as we use the camera more, I'll update the review.

Reviews.Title: All I expected.
Reviews.Author: JoAnn Lawry
Reviews.Content: The Nikon S4000 has been a pleasure to use. Because it's so small, I have it with me much more - just drop it in my pocket when I walk out the door. I have not yet had to recharge the battery although I've used it a few weeks now. That was one of my concerns. The screen cleans easily with a microfiber cloth. The picture quality is very good for my use in taking casual photos. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Slow when taking one picture after another.
Reviews.Author: K. Christensen "Average Dad"
Reviews.Content: First, the camera seemed "way cool" and amazon's description has told you all the great things about it. (High picture quality, HD video, touch screen and so on).  But after a few weeks and months with the camera, the love affair comes to a screeching halt.When taking pictures one after another the camera is very slow. You wait a good 3-4 seconds before a second picture can be taken.The touch screen is a great tool but is somewhat unresponsive. This definitely is not your "iPhone" multi-touch glass. The screen has a somewhat rough texture and gets fingerprints way too easy. It kind of reminds me of a credit card reader at the super market. Sometimes you have to tap multiple times to get it to recognize your input.Lastly, The SD card goes in smooth but doesn't "spring" out very well. Even after you push down to release the spring on the SD card it doesn't come out without some prying.iPhoto USERS!!! Beware! This camera will not automatically orient your pictures to "portrait" if you take a picture with the camera sideways... It is a pain to have to manually rotate each one of your pictures especially when you take as many as my wife does (nearly 50 pics every few days). Please!! Save yourself the hassle and go with a Kodak Easyshare instead. Totally worth your while.I kept this camera for a few months but I couldn't stand to put up with the daily "little hangups" that just make this camera a total nightmare. I just replaced it with a Kodak Easyshare(Kodak EasyShare M575 14MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3.0 Inch LCD (Midnight Black)) and couldn't be happier to be back in Kodak Wonderland!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S4000 12 MP Digital Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Arthur L. Sprague "GL32"
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th compact digital camera since 1999 and is the absolute best. The quality of the images in new digital cameras is consistently excellent, but the features are not. This camera is very intuitive; simple to operate and adjust, and actually fun to use. The touch screen is not a gadget, it makes the camera more of a tool instead of a toy, by allowing on the fly adjustments to compensate for artistic needs as well as image adjustments.I own a Nikon D 60 as well, but this has become my camera of choice because of its compactness, quality and simple flexibility. We are going to Europe in the spring and this is the camera I will take along over the D-60.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it.
Reviews.Author: FamFun "Hammer"
Reviews.Content: My wife really loves this camera.  She likes the color, size, picture quality and touch screen.  She can take it in her purse and have a camera on hand when the kids have a momet you want to capture right then and there.

Reviews.Title: Great Pics Bad video
Reviews.Author: John G. Cossin
Reviews.Content: Great camera for taking pictures. If you are buying this to take video forget it. Very grainy. You have to have perfect light for the video and even then it's not all that great. Takes great pics.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Pleased
Reviews.Author: Rastalady
Reviews.Content: I am extremely pleased with my camera.  Compact so I carry it everywhere.  Taking more pictures than I every have due to its size and ease of use.  Absolutely love it!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: John C. Madsen "jcmadsen"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the S4000 after reading the extensive reviews.  It really came down to the Nikon or the Canon S1400.  The Canon was almost too small, so I decided on the Nikon.  I already had 2 other digital cameras, both Canon, but needed one that could easily slip into my pocket.  The purchase coincided with our family trip to Disney World, where I took approximately 1000 photos.First, the good - the size, feel, battery life and 3 inch touchscreen are all definite pluses. Easy to use on automode.  I've had no problems with charging the camera and getting a full day of photos.However, I have to concur with many of the negative aspects I've read about the camera from other owners/reviewers.  Most frustrating was speed.  When you take a snapshot, you really can't take another for almost 5 seconds.  This is especially annoying when your trying to capture a photo of, say, your child with Mickey Mouse!  You take a pic, and have to give the "one more, just a second, don't move!" line as people are waiting behind you.  When outdoors, I finally switched to "sport" mode, and just held the button down.  That allowed me to get a picture about every 1-2 seconds.  No waiting that way.The photos I took outdoors came out great!  No problem with them.  But, inside?  Well, not so great.  I'll admit, I could probably stand to read up on what setting is best for indoor pics.  But, most point and shoot cameras on automode will adjust for this.  I won't say the pics were a disaster; but, they certainly could be better.As far as video, it really didn't work.  I had two occasions where I was shooting in video mode, indoors, and both times the camera just stopped.  Again, before I say that the video doesn't work at all, I need to do some more experimenting.  I will say I've never had a problem shooting video with my Canons.  But, neither have 720p HD capability.  Perhaps the SD card needs formatting?  I don't know.  I'd like to see if others have issues with the video as I did.As I point out in the title of the review, you pretty much get what you pay for.  At $110, it's a very good price.  The size is great when you don't want to haul around a larger camera, strapped to your shoulder, for 12 hours as you walk all over the Magic Kingdom.  The screen is great, and overall, the pictures are decent.  If you're looking for an economical camera that you can slide into your front pocket, and aren't overly worried about speed of taking multiple picutres, the S4000 can do the trick.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with lack of sharpness
Reviews.Author: MuseumBooks
Reviews.Content: I am a street photographer who usually uses an slr but always carries a pocket camera for grab and go shots.  I certainly don't expect slr quality from a pocket $ 150.00 camera but I expect sharpness in normal lighting conditions.  After about 300 exposures with the Nikon s 4000, I have to say I'm extremely unhappy with the results.  I carried an Olympus weatherproof pocket camera for 5 years with good results and thought it was time to upgrade.  The wider zoom range is a cool feature but not at the expsense of sharpness.  Many of the photos are unusable and I feel that Nikon has a problem with this model.  The video is OK but the stills are almost camera phone soft.  Not a good value in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: VR? What is it exactly?
Reviews.Author: Liwei Sheng
Reviews.Content: I am a little disappointed to find out there is no vibration reduction in 720p video recording. After a little digging, there seems no optical stabilization on board and electronic VR does not work in 720p. My plan is to buy a little one does it all when I go outing with kids, no stabilization on video is not acceptable. I am not a Nikon user yet. But the "VR" that I understood and they used in their DSLRs are all optical stabilization. I purchased the camera locally and returned it easily after the finding. Hope to save you a little trouble if you planed to use the video. Exchanged for dsc-w350 for exactly same price and performance range, and it does have a optical "steady shot" that works in video as well as static picture. It is a pity that I liked the s4000 touch screen and it almost is the one I would hope for.

Reviews.Title: Neatest Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: artmuffin
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera after having read the reviews and I've never seen a camera so full of features!  I was amazed by the touch screen and the clarity/sharpness of the pics I took.  Love the video/audio feature as well.  The battery died after about 15 hours and it was so easy to recharge...took approx. 2 hours for full recharge.  I'm not a professional photographer, barely an amateur, but I know that Nikon is an excellent brand and so far this camera has just amazed me!!  And I have so much more to learn about it!!!

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I had an issue with the flash on first camera I ordered, but as soon as I takled to Amazon customer service, they had another one to me in the mail the following day and I haven't had a single problem! It takes great pictures, even when you have to zoom.  I have had problems in the apst with other cameras where the flash somewhat whites out people's faces, but this flash works very well.  Picture quality is very high! I love the camera and all its features!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: lithlady
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera the day before going on an all day garden tour & didn't have time to read all the instructions, so I winged it. Everything worked fine except couldn't find or figure out where the zoom control was. The Quick Guide didn't mention this function, so there I was, shooting away in regular mode, until I happened upon a young lady (unknown to me) also using a digital camera. Took her all of 2 seconds to find the slider on the shutter button. Duh.This replaced an Olympus D-580 which I disliked for the really small display window. Wow! What a difference. I love this Nikon.Can't comment on all the other goodies this Coolpix S4000 has since I haven't had it long enough to explore and set up the rest of the functions. So far, it rocks!!!Nikon Coolpix S4000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch Touch-Panel LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Continues the Nikon issue of slow speed shooting
Reviews.Author: Monte Abbott
Reviews.Content: This is my third Nikon in the last 10 years and it has the same problem that the previous two had - when you are taking several pictures in a row, the camera needs an eternity to save the previous frame. There I am holding the camera and pushing the shutter button and nothing is happening. By the time the I get the next frame the action is over. This camera does have a 16-shot continuous function but this is not what I need.After my first two Nikons I purchased a Canon and an Olympus. Neither suffered from this limitation. With both of those I could pint, shoot, point, shoot, over and over. The Canon allowed me to select a zero to three second period for each image to be displayed after frame capture. This worked well for my needs. The reason I have gone back to Nikon is that my previous Nikons had noticeably better image quality than the Canon and somewhat better than the Olympus.Unfortunately the Nikon COOLPIX s4000 picture quality is poor. I have taken about 350 pictures with this camera during the past two weeks and about 80% of those are blurry. I'm returning this camera and looking for something else.On the positive side, I love this touch screen. However, what's the use of that if you can't get decent photos? Other things like the attached stylus and the online free storage are just useless for me.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Chels
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for a year, then it stopped working. Would not turn on, I bought a new battery and it still did not work. When I called Nikon I was told I would have to pay to have it sent in ad then fixed. I will never buy a Nikon product again.

Reviews.Title: Great features, Good Price
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Ruth Dirks Garcia
Reviews.Content: Order this camera after our older coolpix (about 5 years old) died a few months ago.  Really like the size, ease of use, the touch screen is very easy to navigate.  The color I ordered was red but it's really almost a fushia (dark pink).  My husband is not a fan of that.  The image quality is good and so is the brightness.  Dark photos indoors were always an issue with our previous coolpix and that is not an issue at all on this camera.  Would highly recommend. I bought the L22 for my teenager for christmas and would recommend spending the extra money to get this camera instead.  Although the L22 is a good camera if you have the money to invest up I would go for it.

Reviews.Title: 5 STARS - 14 YEARS OLD.
Reviews.Author: C. Kasuba "Emily's Mom"
Reviews.Content: I myself have owned a great amount of cameras over the years. I would have to say, about,...5? 6? 7, possibly? can't even keep track anymore. Bought this camera Black Friday shopping, made sure I was one of the first to arrive at RadioShack super early, essentially purchased it, and absolutely fell in love with this amazing camera. As I said, I have owned and been through a fairly big number of useless, dissatisfying cameras, and this one finally reaches my expectations, and more. Love Nikon, my favorite camera brand, ever (second choice is Kodak, if you don't like Nikon's). Comes fully equipped with a touch screen (which I didn't even realize it had, so that was an amazing surplus of what I had already expected), stylus (for the touch screen, also very different but convinent than other "pin/needle-style stylus'", has a different and more user-friendly strategy), 14 megapixels, very slim and easy to carry around, charger (which disconnects into a USB plug for you computer, so its a 2-in-1 type of cord), and even more. Best sleek, amazing camera I have ever owned. Very appreciative of the great quality, and Nikon thought of EVERYTHING for this sleek little thing. TWO THUMBS UP, GUYS!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix is a wonderful camera!  We had to replace ours that went "missing".  The newer model with the larger touch screen is a nice improvement.  We purchased through Amazon as we could buy it for $30 less than in the local store.

Reviews.Title: Very slow in taking pictures
Reviews.Author: KSD
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my 6 yr old Sony camera.  I was hoping this would take faster pictures.  Even after using a Sandisk EXTREME Class 6 SD Card the response time to take a picture was like 2-3 seconds.  Ended up returning it.

Reviews.Title: Instructions
Reviews.Author: Dorothy
Reviews.Content: Complete instructions for this camera are included on a CD.  This is great BUT it's kinda hard to remember everything and without a computer you can't carry the instructions with you (unless you want to print everything and carry around big pages) so it would be better to include a printed instruction booklet as part of the package.Also, the flash recovery time is sooooo slow even with a full battery charge.

Reviews.Title: Truly awful quality- don't buy it!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kathom86
Reviews.Content: I lost my decent Panasonic camera right before I let on vacation for Europe. We borrowed this camera from mom and it was horrible. Using this camera was like wrestling a dinosaur- useless. The touch screen wasn't very responsive, the LED screen quality is poor and no matter what combination of settings we used 2 out of 3 photos were blurry.The picture quality and delay between photos was so frustrating that we almost smashed the camera and bought an expensive new one. We had a beautiful vacation and very little to show for it because this camera is a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Ocracoke Bound "Eternity begins and ends with...
Reviews.Content: I purchased mine two years ago from a big box store. It still works as well as it did the day I purchased it. I have multiple memory cards of different brands, and all work fine with it. I am not kidding when I say i use this nearly every day, and while im not rough on it (ive never dropped it), I am also not super careful with it. Battery life is very good.I am getting ready to upgrade to a DSLR or bridge camera (simply because ive outgrown a basic point and shoot), but will still be using this to keep on hand for those quick snapshots!That said, it is a point and shoot, and as such has its limits. Forget night time or low light photos. The flash will wash everything out. If you are not still, the photo will most likely blur. It's not great for action (ie sports) shots. You may get some good pics, but it will be pure luck. The time it takes to take a photo is slow (to me). The macro feature is pretty decent. I do like the touch screen, and havent had any issues with it.The video on it is ok. Not great, but it shouldnt be used as a video camera exclusively. I've taken plenty of videos of my kids playing and it does the job.the digital zoom on it is ...well... not great (few digital zooms are). The optical zoom is decent though.Overall its a good, solid point and shoot digital camera. MUCH better than the kodak i had previously (which was a piece of garbage) and comparable to my old olympus, which i loved. I would buy it again, and do recommend it.overall, 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Poor After Sales Service
Reviews.Author: Faisal
Reviews.Content: Had bought this Camera, expecting it to last longer than 04 months, after which it started giving defected images. Called the customer service department of Nikon who asked me to submit defected images online, which the camera was taking. This I had to do twice. Than I was asked to send the camera for repairs. I was expecting the camera to be repaired and delivered back, instead of repairing this camera under warranty the company charged me $108/-!!!Will never buy a Nikon camer again!.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures if you carry a tripod everywhere
Reviews.Author: I. Resendiz "Charmin Bear"
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this camera if you like/need to take pictures in a hurry, anytime, anywhere, etc. Pictures will come out fine in daylight and if the subject is not moving. Performance under any other situation will leave you with a blurred and useless photo. I should have known better than to buy it since I already own a CoolPix L100. I needed a camera with a smaller profile and so I got it.The touch screen is very nice (if you use the stylus) and the pictures look great on the 3" display. That is my problem. Often I will take a picture and review it immediately to make sure it's good. Once I'm at my computer it'll be a different story and I'll be disappointed.Another (minor) detail that ticked me was that the USB cable only works with the charger provided. I travel intensively and I try to minimize the number of adapters in my suitcase. This cable will not work with my other AC and car chargers.Overall, this is a good camera if you only plan to use it for the casual outdoor gatherings or landmarks. Don't count on it for getting a view of the Manhattan skyline at night.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S4000
Reviews.Author: Camera Bug
Reviews.Content: I do landscape photography with high-end cameras, but I use a point-and-shoot camera to scout potential locations. The S4000 replaced my old Fuji. It has a large 3-inch LCD screen that is sharp and reasonably bright. I especially like the touch screen, which I find easier to use than the cryptic buttons on most small cameras. The zoom lens goes down to 26mm, which is wider than most. The telephoto end is only 105mm, but that should be enough for most users. Picture quality is acceptable. This camera is discontinued, so it represents an excellent value at the clearance sale price. One special feature of this camera (which is essential to my scouting needs) is the capability to add voice memos to your photos (up to 20 seconds). The first camera I received had a defective touch screen and was exchanged. (A+ to Amazon's return/exchange service and policy. I received a replacement 3 days later). The only negative is I used it to take photos at my granddaughter's birthday party at an indoor facility. An anemic flash causes the camera to select a high ISO and the resulting pictures were very noisy. I didn't make any prints yet, but I'd say any prints above 4x6 would show the noise.

Reviews.Title: 3 months and still working like the day i purchased
Reviews.Author: AshleyOlivia
Reviews.Content: This camera has been left in my vehicle countless times at -20 degree weather in ND and it still starts up and snaps photos like the day i got it. Nikon is a deffinte win!

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix S4000
Reviews.Author: Albert F. Fraioli
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera I bought it for my daughter for Christmas and she loves it.I own an SLR and have been in photography for over 30 years so I am qualified to speak on the attributes of this camera.The image quality for a point and shoot is exceptional clear and crisp great color and exposure. Nikon has always been known for their great lenses flash and metering systems. The camera has lots of very cool features starting with the 3 inch touchscreen that can be used to trigger the shutter.There is plenty of options to keep you busy and it is a great device with excellent build quality ease of use and produces excellent results with a minimum of effort.The extremely affordable price makes it one of the best deals you will find on the market and I highly reccommend it for anyone looking for solid performance.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Connie A. Pietrala "quilt person"
Reviews.Content: Reading the directions gave me a headache so after a couple of days of regret I just started to take some pictures-- What great clear shots with super easy point and shoot. I let the camera decide about light and they came out great. I will do more as time goes by and reread the direction and learn all the function that this very nice camera has.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our trip to Amsterdam....I did not want to bring my BIG Nikon camera. Suprisingly this takes GREAT pics, just a little slow when taking back to back pictures. LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Review
Reviews.Author: Mastercraft
Reviews.Content: I am writing on behalf of my 14 year old, I bought this for her birthday a couple of months ago and all of my exposure to this camera has been wonderful. She found it herself after reading tons of reviews, we think she picked a winner. She has taken around 300 photo's and they all look great.

Reviews.Title: It does the job
Reviews.Author: Buyer1
Reviews.Content: It's good and does the job, my friend got a panasonic one with similar specs at 60% of the price.The only real complaint that I have is that when taking videos, sometimes it displays the message "cannot read the card", and everything freezes as if it is running out of battery, although the battery is full (and the card is fine). This happened to me twice so far (I have had the camera for a month now).

Reviews.Title: Nikon S4000 Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Sonia
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my Nikon S4000 Coolpix camera, it is very portable and user friendly. A must have when you go on vacation. My husband and I both used it on our recent vacation and it was great, took a ton of pictures of excellent quality. Who knew a tiny, cute camera would take such great pictures. My daughters both have one and they are also very happy with it. I am impressed with the drop in price which makes them a lot more enticing.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Rena
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. It takes very clear pictures. Im so happy about the shipping and how fast it was delivered to me. I definently would order from this place again. This camera is awesome!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: David R. Norcross
Reviews.Content: good pictures this is the 2nd camera of this type due to wife dropping purse out of car at a store. needless to say i ran over it.. but it still took great pic's, just coulden't view them but pulled out the card and they were great  pics. this camera is 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Poor Design makes camara almost useless
Reviews.Author: Windy City Grey
Reviews.Content: The camera itself takes a nice photo.However the mini-usb port and cables are poorly designed.  There is no clear indication which way to insert the cable into the camera, and the instruction manual is equally obtuse in showing you.  Unfortunately it doesn't take much force to damage the av input.  The camera is only 2 months old, and this is only the 3rd time to charge the battery.To resolve the broken av input, I had to order a separate Nikon battery charger, to re-charge the battery.  To move photos to my computer, I have to remove the SD card from the camera, and use a card reader.  These extra steps are the reason for this poor review.  A good design would have clearly shown how to plug in the cables, a better design would have used a more robust input jack.  If you buy this camera, be very careful when plugging into the av input jack.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: monique11
Reviews.Content: i have had nikon coolpix s3300 & s4300 but when i had gotten this  nikon coolpix s4000  was crisp and clear has a nice screen and this is a touch screen a nice plum its features is easy and is a very attractive camera it takes good photos this nikon takes pictures every thing is more visible mean some how most times i take photos, my feet or shoes are faded just got this january 2014 even in doors shooting is clear and visible if you have digital cameras you know it have alot of shooting scenes the attached touch on the little rope pin for the touch screen i was so stunned when i got this beacause i take pictures more in doors than out, and the scenes seem to be all the wild to go through in my living room i didnt have to keep the light on but to small dim lamps picture caught every thing,it does need a memory card and would take at least 14 pictures without the greatest investment i need look any furthur

Reviews.Title: worked well for a while
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas in 2011.  It worked great at first.  It isnt used often and I noticed the lens cover started jamming and wouldn't close properly.  After that, I wouldn't leave the house with it.  Pulled it out again to use for Christmas photos this year and now it is making a loud clicking noise, even "rattling" while idle.  Photos are coming out blurry and shutter is taking forever to release.  Its a shame that this camera turned into junk so quickly.  Sadly this will be the first and last Nikon that I will own.

Reviews.Title: pretty good
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Had for two years now. Great camera but video function doesn't work right. It will record sometimes but can only be played by vlc player.

Reviews.Title: lovee it
Reviews.Author: Patricia Iniguez
Reviews.Content: Was not what I expected, it was much better and I am very satisfied with my purchase, I would definitely buy again

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S4000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration...
Reviews.Author: inga
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S4000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration...That's great!It is very, very good. I am happy with the purchase!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: BabyBlueOnes
Reviews.Content: Easy to use!  Takes sharp, clear pictures at normal distances.  Close ups of small objects are very blurry.  I had hoped that 12 MP would be enough to overcome the tendency of blurring close-ups.  As long as you don't need it for close-ups of smaller objects, it's a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Good product for beginners
Reviews.Author: RP
Reviews.Content: I gifted this camera to my sisters. They have been using it since last two years. It's working great..I would recommend this product to beginners

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Anita Dowing MacDonald
Reviews.Content: It was a replacement for the same camera that I lost.  So I ordered it because of my familiarity with the product.  It's fine for the price, but it's so compact that it's hard to perform some tasks, such as removing/installing the picture card.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't recommend
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: It takes decent pictures but the touch screen doesn't work great and requires multiple touches sometimes t execute your command.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over three years now and it is an excellent buy...takes great pics and the functionality is good.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: Peggy Sue Wilburn
Reviews.Content: this was a graduation gift.  the student tat received the gift loved the gift and has used it many times since receiving it.

Reviews.Title: BEST CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Iremlab "Balme"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It's amazing! It takes very nice pictures, and it has excellent functions. I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures, but slow shutter speed
Reviews.Author: H. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because reviews led me to believe that it was fast and with cats in my home that's what I needed.  But as it turns out it was actually slower than the old kodak that I'd been using for the previous 10 years. It takes at least 4-5 seconds between pictures. That's not to say that its not a nice camera, it produces clear pictures, the touch screen is a nice feature and it charges on a cord rather than using batteries.  But I wouldn't recommend it for anyone who wants to take pictures rapidly, or take pictures of fidgety children or animals.

Reviews.Title: Takes fairly good photos
Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: Battery life is not that great.  Photos are good.  Occasionally it takes longer than normal to save a photo before being ready to take another photo.  It was good for the money.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera, hate the battery and some features
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I love this camera as far as the quality of the pictures.  However, the battery stinks and sometimes it gets into a mode and no matter what I hit on the screen I can't get it back.  Otherwise, it's a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: iShine
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great basic camera. The photo quality is great coming from this tiny camera. The only thing I dislike, the touch screen. Sometimes I have to press hard to get it to work. Like sliding between photos when reviewing, this is a pain. I guess I miss my old S3000 and the buttons. The camera is great, I guess i prefer buttons, since everything i use is touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Okay but could be better
Reviews.Author: AndrewPh
Reviews.Content: This camera's touch screen works very well, I had no problem with that. But, the images taken by the camera are more often than not, blurry. It is very difficult to take a clear picture. You have to be a statue taking pictures because it detects the slightest movements which eventually result in a horrible picture. I would recommend this camera if you like touch screen and different features but If you don't have patience, then try looking for something else.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: This is our second one of these particular camera since we dropped and destroyed our first one. The camera is small light and takes a good picture for a point and shoot camera. It was a good purchase and we would definitely buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Died after 18 months (Planned obsolescence?)
Reviews.Author: Nick "Nickstock"
Reviews.Content: A couple of months ago (around 18 months after I bought it) I got the "Lens Error" deadlock message. Tomorrow I'll have to send it to service.Digging a little bit I've found that is a very common failure when the lens get jammed (apparently with sand particles).Anyway, not a very recommended camera. :(

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S4000 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch Touch-Panel LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: Love2Read
Reviews.Content: I had seen this specific camera in Walmart and tested it. I really liked it. Then when I went back to purchase it from Walmart they were gone. It was being discontinued. Finally, I found it on Amazon which saved me money. I ordered the camera and when I got it I starting using it right away. I do like the camera but one thing I noticed is if you put it onto video mode with a memory card in it a lot of times it will say error. Not sure if it is the camera or the memory card that is having the problem. Also sometimes when you zoom in to take a picture it comes out blurry. Otherwise it takes awesome photos and when I print my photos they are of great quality.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Justo
Reviews.Content: When i buy the camera the lens  did not open i check you tube and i found the solution for the price was good

Reviews.Title: Love this.
Reviews.Author: M. Mullainathan "Desert Rat"
Reviews.Content: Good compact rich features. Nothing special about this but does what it is supposed to do. Entry level camear at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a good price.
Reviews.Author: lisah1965
Reviews.Content: I love my camera, especially the touch screen.  It has great features and it's a great color, I got the red.  I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: A few bad things that I'm regretting
Reviews.Author: mrstravelsalot
Reviews.Content: This camera could be great for some people depending on what kind of pictures you want to take. I've noticed that mine can't take pictures if the lighting isn't perfect. I've changed the settings to maximize the clarity of the colors, but everything comes back an orange blur. I've called in and asked about it and basically got a shrug since my warrenty was out.The screen also gets dirty very fast, since it is a touch screen. I've heard that the texture of it (matte, or something) is what causes this.I've read a LOT of reviews about this and it apparently has a horrible problem with connecting to the computer and charging (many people are complaining about that). Mine hasn't had that problem yet, but by the amount of people talking about it I'm guessing it's not a one-time issue.

Reviews.Title: I Like It!!!!
Reviews.Author: T. Glover "crisquo_02"
Reviews.Content: It is a really nice camera. Its small and easy to carry with you any place. Love the touch screen, really good feature.

Reviews.Title: handy, easy little camera
Reviews.Author: Carol W. Dunbar
Reviews.Content: This camera is easily slipped into a pocket but is ready for a picture in an instant.  Sharp photos and camera is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: M. JENKINS "MJDJ1231"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for myself for Christmas.  I really bought it because it was under $100.  I LOVE it!  Ive only had it a week and have taken lots of pictures! Im still trying to figure out the features but what I've played with, I've loved!  Quality of picture is great!  Small, lightweight camera that I throw in my purse and ready to go!  This is my 'fun' camera that I use for whatever...I have an expensive Sony camera for other pics but Im seeing the quality of these pictures is really good!  I read the negative reviews on this camera and dont understand why....what I would suggest is if your pics are coming out blurry, take several shots of the same thing til you get it right! :) I dont think you will be disappointed in this lil camera!

Reviews.Title: Big disappointment
Reviews.Author: mwalk
Reviews.Content: This camera was a much-anticipated gift for my daughter.  Unfortunately, it has been a huge disappointment!  The camera is not very user-friendly, the pictures are generally blurry, and the camera broke within the first couple of months of use. It has been sent off to Nikon for repairs two times, and the last time, Nikon refused to honor the warranty.  The camera erased pictures from the memory card, the lens would stick frequently, the zoom causes the camera to shut-off and brings up a 'lens-error'.  I know that Nikon is a name brand, but their customer service is terrible.  I would discourage anyone from buying this camera.  My daughter is saving her money for a Cannon.

Reviews.Title: 720 P
Reviews.Author: G.S
Reviews.Content: You can not take a movie with the 720p. It keep crashing. You must change it  to a lower resolution .

Reviews.Title: Battery died
Reviews.Author: Diane Vecchione
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera for christmas gift. The battery died and would not take a charge anymore 4 mths after Christmas. emailed seller, told to contact the camera manufacturer. = (  not happy.  tested camera with friends battery. It worked. Now I have to see if I can get a new battery under warrenty or buy a new 1.

Reviews.Title: I hate it
Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: A LOT of problems in only one month! I have bought it cause I am traveling and I've lost my other camera...so I've hurried up a little bit..stupid thing!First of all, the photo and video quality is bad (for photos if people move, it's definitely blurred; video - only on daylight it's ok...). As if it was not enough, after 3 weeks...it doesn't work anymore! And I didn't drop it, anything. "optic problem"...don't know why, but...as the technical service assured by the guarantee will keep it from 15 to 30 days, I definitely have to buy another camera!Horrible..

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera, best purchase I've made all year.
Reviews.Author: Michelle19
Reviews.Content: Excellent price and value, this camera is very easy to use and large display makes for easy photo review.  Highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Relative poor performance in mechanical system
Reviews.Author: Jack Zhang "Jack"
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for couple weeks.  Two problems1)  Auto focus is not sharp (sometime it works and sometime does not, this machine only has auto_focus mode)2)  Sometime push on power the camera lense out then goes back, you need shut power off and on again.It seems that the machine's mechanical system has some problem.'Touch screen' works fine.  It is quite simple to use.

Reviews.Title: Ready to use out of the box, but read the manual anyway
Reviews.Author: Joan W. Johnson "average reader"
Reviews.Content: I love love love my new Nikon Coolpix S4000. Every digital camera I have owned up to this has been a Kodak point and click, but I was ready to take the next step and purchase a camera that had more features. This camera was the perfect "next step".Right out of the box I was able to use the camera for standard photos. With a little time, I was soon taking extreme closeups with the micro lens feature, and panoramic photos. Now I'm at the point where I'm reading the manual and learning all the nuances of the camera - and there are many!This is the first touch screen I've owned, and it's easy to use and understand. I purchased an 8 gig card to go with the camera, and can take long hi-def videos of the grandchildren.There are many features I still need to learn, but with just a small learning curve on the more enhanced features I've read about so far, I have no doubt I'll be using it like a pro in the near future.Highly recommend this camera to anyone ready to take the "next step" from a digital point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: duckyponder
Reviews.Content: Bottom line--what I like:1. Macro mode is decent2. It is 12 MP but if you're not needing that high of resolution or what to get more pictures per memory card, there are other settings for lower megapixels3. Takes bright, crisp pictures4. Flash is great--doesn't wash out like previous cameras I've had5. Touch screen makes for less button pushing to change different settings6. The camera feature is excellent.  Great sound...amazing clear videos.7. slim, lightweight design.  You could put it in your pocket if you wanted.8. when playing video back, the camera actually has speakers to hear it.  My old camera didn't which was annoying.9. you can touch the screen to tell the camera what part of the picture to focus on.What I don't like:1. Touch screen can be a little frustrating.  If you're used to the touch screens on smartphones or ipods, this one isn't as seamless.  You have to press harder and sometimes a few times before it processes that you've made a selection.2. speed.  In most settings, the camera takes what feels like too long to allow for another picture.  So when taking action pictures, or trying to get that blurry baby picture to be clear, you want to take several pictures rapidly....the only way to do this is to do the multi image, but then you ahve to edit those out seperately.  It's just kind of annoying.3. Reds don't seem QUITE as brilliant as they should be.4. blink feature.  Doesn't work as it should....seems kind of pointless to me.5. different colors cost different amounts?  not a big deal but I got the plum one because it was cheapest.Overall...if I had to purchase a camera again right now, I'd very likely pick this one again.

Reviews.Title: It's good
Reviews.Author: Jejelinda
Reviews.Content: It's good. It's not a professional camera. So if you are looking for a camera to take pictures just for fun,for vacations or something like that it's perfect. I just don't like the touch screen too much..

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: ferg
Reviews.Content: For the price, this camera is a great buy.  It takes bright, beautiful photos and videos.  However, The memory card that Amazon bundled with mine does not read when trying to take videos so it may need a different brand memory card than sandisk.  Other than that, no complaints whatsoever. Nikon is a great brand and deserves credit for such a product.

Reviews.Title: Money WELL Spent!!!
Reviews.Author: Tomcat2blue
Reviews.Content: Of the camera's I've purchased in the past, I would have to say that this one is by far the BEST! Absolutely LOVE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!!
Reviews.Author: ArmyWife07
Reviews.Content: i myself have the nikon cool pix s3000 and bought this for my husband as a present i now find myself stealing his camera to take pictures! i love this camera. the picutres it takes are AWESOME!!! i would buy this camera over and over again. and the touch screen is sooo coool- when i post pictures to my facebook people cant believe i took the pictures and not  a professional!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jud
Reviews.Content: was looking for somthing for our daughter. small with good qualities and priced right. Read the reviews of others and went with my gut feeling. Made the Right Choice. yes i would recommend it to others.Only wish i had this and not the one i got for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Satified
Reviews.Author: kellydog80
Reviews.Content: had one before and loved til i dropped it. I bought this new one and very satified. the touch screen and option are veryy easy. It takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: lesquivel
Reviews.Content: This camera is great and the touch screen makes it fantastic. Pictures came out great. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: very good product but problem with card reader
Reviews.Author: Binayak R. Joshi
Reviews.Content: this product is very gud as expected, but it does not work when i inserted 16 GB SDHC card class 10....it works in the movie format of 320p but not on HD of 720P or 640p..whenever i tried to use the video in those mode, the msg appears" card cannot be read."...if u r thinking of using the video in HD,then think again, otherwise the camera is the best in this price..pictures r perfect and clear at night time too.

Reviews.Title: xcellent cam
Reviews.Author: alvan
Reviews.Content: this is the best i have seen a camera of that size. The quility of the pics are great. I strongly recommend it

Reviews.Title: good for you
Reviews.Author: nini
Reviews.Content: it's very good for you to choose it.I will never be regret to make order for these item.good credit.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for everyone!
Reviews.Author: Fashionistamama
Reviews.Content: We have always owned very bulky, professional & pricey cameras but with children it's so difficult to always carry it around. This camera is perfect! The size is not a reflection of it capabilites! It takes great pictures, very easy to use (a little guide reading involved) and so small you can carry it everywhere you go. We love it and have taken so many more pictures because of it's ease.Best of all, compared to stores around our city and online, we couldn't have gotten a better price!

Reviews.Title: I love my new camera
Reviews.Author: amuda
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my new camera. The pictures are great. The touch screen is so easy to use and convenient.I couldn't be happier especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price!
Reviews.Author: Franchy
Reviews.Content: I love the Camera, specially for the cheap price... the color is really nice and it has a lot of nice features that I have yet to explore but is really worth it!! =)

Reviews.Title: Slow reload speed
Reviews.Author: ladyblue_bison
Reviews.Content: I like my Nikon Coolpix.  It's a pretty great camera.  The one thing that makes this camera so frustrating, and why I give it 3 stars is because of the reload speed.  I feel like I've missed some great moments simply because it takes the camera soooo long to load and reload.  This is an otherwise great camera if it were not for that.

Reviews.Title: Nice and easy camera
Reviews.Author: Alvaro Escalante
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife. She never reads product manuals and with the Coolpix S4000, there is not need to read any manual. The usage is very intuitive.In terms of image quality, the camera produces very rich color, sharp images, well lit. Even with the usage of the body flash the camera produces a good light balance. The camera is not fast for shooting continues photos, but of course you can not expect this from a point 'n shoot.The focus motor is a little bit noise on continues focus mode, which may led the user to think there is a malfunction.The camera is light, it looks cool and the screen is big enough to enjoy the photos right away. The touchscreen is very sensitive and provides a convenient interface, limiting the pushing of external buttons.The USB port on the camera serves to interface with the computer and to charge the battery. A nice feature if you forgot your charger.The only thing I don't like is the play mode. The lens is not guarded when the play mode is active, making the grabbing of the camera somewhat awkward. That's why I'm rating this 4 stars.Overall, my wife is very pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellence Picture
Reviews.Author: Slick
Reviews.Content: Great Camera! I'm gonna be honest, it takes excellent pictures. Sometimes it gives a blur when you aren't steady but thats obvious. But all in all it takes great pictures. The functions are really cool, many were awed by the touch screen operation and it's really easy to operate. The picture editing is great as well, I can easily edit it right on the camera and just post to the net with words, colour and even my own little art work.Now, the video quality is good as well, not forgetting sound quality that comes with it. But note, when shooting in HD/zoom you have to be really steady cause it constantly fuzzes, blurs and distorts the video. I did a clip from a balcony shooting some performers and it was constantly doing this. So I guess its movement when in zoom that causes it to fuzz so much. But mind u the Video in general is great.

Reviews.Title: Great, compact camera...doesn't take the best pics in low light
Reviews.Author: Aimee
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid for this camera, I love it! I had accidentally broken my super nice Canon camera right before vacation and ordered this one since I have to take pictures while on vaca! Majority of the pictures came out very nice! The colors are true and images are crisp. The only times I had problems with the camera, were when I was in low light conditions...yeah I don't walk around with an itty bitty tripod to put my camera on to stabilize it so that it can take a decent shot. That's my only complaint. I love the rechargable battery. You can easily take over 200 pictures per charge and I absolutely LOVE the touch screen. I wasn't sure how I feel about the touchscreen, but it's my favorite feature. Any questions, please ask.

Reviews.Title: This camera is everything I wanted.  It's easy to use and small enough to carry in my purse.
Reviews.Author: c parsons
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I wanted in a camera.  It's easy to use and small enough to carry in my purse so I always have it with me.  Having 7 grandchildren that's a plus!I read the reviews on Amazon.com before purchasing and I've found all the pluses I read about.My hands shake a lot but with the anti-shake gizmo my pictures come out perfect!

Reviews.Title: Terrific
Reviews.Author: horsespatoot "horsespatoot"
Reviews.Content: I am pleased as punch with this camera. I struggled for years with a Kodak digital camera that was the most un-user friendly piece of junk ever. I finally broke down and bough the Nikon S4000 to replace the Kodak junker. Wow !! What a difference. Great pics and so easy to use. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Pretty much exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Nina Paparazzo
Reviews.Content: This product was generally exactly what I wanted. I have had a few issues with the touch screen, but nothing major. It takes pictures very quickly and they are very clear. I am very very pleased with this purchase. I am in college, so I didn't want anything too spectacular. Just a camera to take pictures of my family and friends. This is perfect for that.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: meandertruth
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use. It takes great pictures and although it would have been nice to have it take longer video I still am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: AWSOME CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Perla Loa
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA IS GREAT FOR BEING REFURBISHED! CAME IN AS A PRESENT TO MY MOTHER.. EASY TO USE! I AM VERY PLEASED WITH THE QUALITY AND SPEED ON THE SHIPPIN. WELL I HAVE TO SAY OVERALL I'M HAPPY WITH IT SO FAR... =)

Reviews.Title: Great Camara, so far!!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Herrera "Immigrant feeling."
Reviews.Content: We are really happy to get this camara. Wonderful pictures, clarity and just in the first try, cloudy or lighty!!

Reviews.Title: great service
Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: Over all I`m very happy with the delivery and packing serivce.everything about the camera is great.The only thing I feel could be better with the product is when trying to take pictures the delay is longer than normal.The picture quality is great.I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: easy camera
Reviews.Author: veronica
Reviews.Content: I wanted an easy to use point and shoot camera and found it with the Nikon Coolpix S4000.  I'm very happy with it.  It is small and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good -- Not Great
Reviews.Author: MLB1037
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace the Coolpix S3000 that I lost a few months prior. I like the design and think it is relatively easy to use but it takes terrible pictures at night. I have tried multiple settings to get clearer pictures after dark but can't seem to capture anything worth keeping.

Reviews.Title: Nice features, Unacceptable picture quality
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: The camera is very easy to use and has nice set of features, but the photo quality is very low (specialty in low light). The pictures are grainy even in good light conditions. My 4 year old 8MP Canon, makes much better pictures.Update: The battery died after about a year of very light use - won't hold charge for more than a week. Total waste of money....

Reviews.Title: Quite disappointed...
Reviews.Author: Tatyana M. Djehdian
Reviews.Content: What I liked about this camera when I was first looking for one was:1) 3.0 display2) the fact that was touchscreen3) being a quite small camera4) In average, good reviewsSo, it really has all this stuff. But...1) It freezes quite often, specially when I am using "protect"2) In my first week using it, I took 68 pictures; 64 of which are showing blank, although the files do exist (tried everything, they are really blank)3) Picture quality is somewhat questionable for the 12Mpx status...4) I am really upset that my 64 pictures are blankHonestly, I was not the only one disappointed. All my friends were counting on this camera for the party, where we took all these pictures, as everybody forgot their cameras. I said is brand new, I have no face now to tell them that the pictures are... like not there. The worst part? They showed up in the video mode right after we took the pictures, but for some reason, in the next day, these same pictures are blank. The last 4 are fine, no issues. Go figure...I can't really say is the camera fault though, it could also be the SDHC card's fault. Anyway, the other aspects remain.Overall the camera is good. Not as good as my previous camera, a canon, but works just fine. I think I was the unlucky one here...

Reviews.Title: Nikon camera
Reviews.Author: Beverly Hatfield
Reviews.Content: We really like this camera. We used it at the Christmas holidays and it was great. Nice screen for viewing. Our only compaint was receiving it. It took at least a month and a half and we were planning to use it earlier. Amazon was not as supportive as we would have liked on tracking it down.

Reviews.Title: Great Pix
Reviews.Author: Harry D. Studebaker
Reviews.Content: The pictures taken from this camera were some of the most crisp and clear I have seen from a camera of this price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Great product. Purchased as a gift for my wife and she loved it. Picture quality is great even when going from camera to computer. She loves the touch screen and ease of menu usage.

Reviews.Title: Bought this for a friend
Reviews.Author: K. Schwanz
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for a friend.  I haven't used it personally but he says he really likes it.  The one thing he found a bit difficult was using the touch screen with just a finger, it was slow and unresponsive to touch, but he said when using the stylus that comes with it works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: nmreaper
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my husband's birthday. It is easy to operate, and takes beautiful pictures. We couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and great value
Reviews.Author: sunny
Reviews.Content: the nikon coolpix s4000 is a great camera. pictures come out really good for something in this price range. they don't look like the ones from a SLR but thats what you get for $120. the touch screen is good, not great but the stylus really helps. i wish they had mad a slot in the camera body to insert the stylus. the speed is great and response time is fast. i also like the in camera picture editing software. i wish nikon had included a better panorama option instead of the "assist". it needs something like sony's sweep panorama.i have had it for about a month and no problems have occured yet.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: leon sikes
